Higher work participation per se does not lead to better outcomes unless they are vocationally trained.

They face various forms of discrimination, including job-typing that pushes them into low-paying jobs. Higher work participation per se does not lead to better outcomes unless they are vocationally trained.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Vision of Shri Ramprash Upadhaya Uchhatar Madhyamik Shiksha Samity, Nagla Kanchan, Etah Distt.Etah U.P. is to bring back the lost childhood of neglected, differently able and working children. We wish to build a world that treats every child equally and grow from teenage to adulthood in healthy, peaceful and dignified and finding ways to make the world as the best place for all. Mission is to protect childrenâ€™s rights , to help them meet their basic needs and to expand opportunities to achieve their full potential. Guided by dreams and aspirations of thousands of differently able, neglected street and working children, Promove pursues its mission with both commitment and Compassion because the children it serves deserve the best. EDUCATION AND TRAINING CENTER Education empowers individual to live with dignity and contribute towards national integrity and development. Unfortunately, there are innumerable children in our country who might have never seen a school or complete. Elementary education. The government system has been unable to reach out to millions of children depriving them of their fundamental rights. the situatioin of street children, slum children and working children are made all the more difficult by poverty, lack of a home , difficult working conditions, exploitation and various types of abuse in we feel that education is the key to alleviate the problems of these children. Since its inception in 2011. We are working on this mission through various non formal education centre located at Etah. From a mere 25 beneficiaries, its strength has grown for covering a total of 10000 children throughout the targeted area. We have a barrier free building allowing access without any help to all the persons in need. DISABLE SECTOR There is an estimation that there are 70 million disabled people in India 3% of the countryâ€™s total child population falls in this category. No effort is made to give them a better world-a small gift of a hearing aid, Braille kit, calliper or a wheel chair will make the difference. About the various schemes being implemented by the Samity. He specially emphasised about the medical expenditure riembursed by the National Trust and the treatment is free in hospitals. To get the benefits, the beneficiaries have to be registered first with the national trust. Local level committee will help the beneficiaries while being registered. Shri Ramprash Upadhaya UMSS Nagla Kanchan Etah. He said that the Samity is with the beneficiaries and the dedicated organization like this one. We ensure that proper healthcare service facilities are provided to all target groups covered under the various projects. Promove health services supports children and their parents from he most marginalized communities through monthly health check up. Furthermore, health camps are organized to spread awareness within the communities.
